      • createRootPane

        protected RootPane createRootPane()
        Description copied from class: BasicTWLGameState
        Override this method to customize the root pane for your UI for this state.

        The theme name of the RootPane created by this method is "state"+getID(). It will also register all action methods to the rootPane.

        Do not call this method. Call BasicTWLGameState.getRootPane() instead

        When overriding this method don't call BasicTWLGameState.getRootPane() from within this method or it will lead to an endless loop.

        Overrides:
        createRootPane in class BasicTWLGameState
        Returns:
        the created root pane
        See Also:
        ActionMap.Action, ActionMap.addMapping(java.lang.Object), Widget.setActionMap(de.matthiasmann.twl.ActionMap), Widget.setTheme(java.lang.String)

      • getPlayer1Error

        public java.lang.String getPlayer1Error()
        This method should return the name input error message for player one.
        Returns:
        the error message for the name input of player one (empty String if the name is ok) or null in case the game is not in the GameSetupState

      • getPlayer2Error

        public java.lang.String getPlayer2Error()
        This method should return the name input error message for player two.
        Returns:
        the error message for the name input of player two (empty String if the name is ok) or null in case the game is not in the GameSetupState

      • getEmptyError

        public java.lang.String getEmptyError()
        This method should provide the tests with your custom error message for the case that a name input field is left empty
        Returns:
        the message your game shows if a player's name input field is left empty and the start game button is pressed

      • getEqualError

        public java.lang.String getEqualError()
        This method should provide the tests with your custom error message for the case that player one and player two choose the same name
        Returns:
        the message your game shows if both player names are equals and the start game button is pressed

      • startGameButton

        public void startGameButton()

      • layoutRootPane

        protected void layoutRootPane()
        Description copied from class: BasicTWLGameState
        This method is called when the layout of the root pane needs to be updated. Widget position and size should only be changed within this method.
        Overrides:
        layoutRootPane in class BasicTWLGameState
        See Also:
        Widget.setPosition(int, int), Widget.setSize(int, int), Widget.adjustSize()

      • handleEditFieldInput

        void handleEditFieldInput(int key,
                          de.matthiasmann.twl.EditField editField,
                          de.matthiasmann.twl.EditField.Callback callback,
                          int maxLength)
        Method gets called if you type something into the input field. Makes sure that you can only type up to maxLength digits into the field.
        Parameters:
        key - the pressed button
        editField - which field to edit
        callback - the callback on the field
        maxLength - max length of digits that you may type into the editField
